At-a-Glance: Residue-aware comb management protects product quality and bee health.
Why it Matters: Reduces contamination risk in honey and wax products.
Step-by-Step: 1) Track treatments by batch and date per hive.
2) Rotate out old brood comb regularly (e.g., 3-year cycle).
3) Use dedicated 'food-grade' supers with no recent treatments.
4) Render old comb separately and label outputs.
Common Pitfalls: Mixing treated brood comb with honey supers
Further Reading: Residue minimisation guidance for small producers
